info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 19 at 7:09PM EDT until July 19 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Albemarle.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 708 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported flooding along Preddy Creek with several roads washed out in the area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Westmoreland... Hollymead... Stony Point... Cismont... Cobham... Carrsbrook... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING
